content.description: <math alttext="f of x, equals, e to the x power, for x less than or equal to negative 1; f of x, equals, x cubed, plus 2 x, for negative 1 less than x, less than or equal to 0; f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 5 x, and denominator x minus 2, end fraction, for 0 less than x, less than or equal to 4; f of x, equals, the cosine of, 3 x, for x greater than 4." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given above. On which of the following intervals is <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> continuous?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 5, comma 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 1, comma 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 comma 5, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 1, comma 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
